quotes.quote: He was born early. But he was born within a safe range of premature
Part of the bargain of being alive is that one takes a chance at dying a premature or painful death, be it from violence, accident, or disease.
Two premature babies was not a genetic thing; we were just unlucky.
A superstition is a premature explanation that overstays its time.
To realize the value of one month, ask a mother who had a premature baby.
Premature burial works just fine as a cure for adolescence.
Many premature babies are never given a chance to make it out of the hospital.
Premature success gives one an almost mystical conception of destiny as opposed to will power-at its worst the Napoleonic delusion.
The superman is a premature ideal, one that presupposes man.
Premature optimization is the root of all evil in programming.
To be premature is to be perfect
A baby is born with a need to be loved - and never outgrows it.
A babe in the house is a well-spring of pleasure, a messenger of peace and love, a resting place for innocence on earth, a link between angels and men.
Premature development of the powers of both mind and body leads to an early grave.
Nothing leads the scientist so astray as a premature truth.
Premature rate cuts could trigger inflationary expectations that could reduce, if not reverse, the capital inflows.
It's way too premature to talk about a recovery.
More strategies fail because they are overripe than because they are premature
Irritable Judges suffer from a bad case of premature adjudication.
